dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 9030 IH: Repealing the Ill-Conceived and Problematic (RIP) Book Minimum Tax Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Arrington (for himself, Mrs. Miller of West Virginia, Mr. Ferguson, Mr. Schweikert, Mr. Pfluger, Mr. Rice of South Carolina, Mr. Wenstrup, Mr. LaHood, Mr. Estes, Mr. Kustoff, Mr. Kelly of Pennsylvania, Mr. Murphy of North Carolina, and Ms. Van Duyne) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To repeal the corporate alternative minimum tax.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Repealing the Ill-Conceived and Problematic (RIP) Book Minimum Tax Act .

section.header: Repeal of corporate alternative minimum tax

subsection.text: Section 10101 and section 13904(a) of Public Law 117â€“169 are repealed.
The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall be applied and administered as if such sections (and the amendments made by such sections) had not been enacted.
